intro: Lappula cynoglossoides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed lappula, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its small, showy flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Its leaves are narrow and alternate, with a distinctive ribbed structure. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds.
